newsitem.title: MEXICO: Sidek says shares up on market tide.
newsitem.headline: Sidek says shares up on market tide.

text.p: Troubled Mexican conglomerate Grupo Sidek denied on Thursday it had made any announcement of a financial restructuring agreement and said the sharp gains in its price followed general market movement.
Grupo Sidek shares were up four centavos to 40 centavos in midday trade on the Mexican bourse, while its tourist subsidiary Situr had gained four centavos to 29 centavos.
"We have made no restructuring announcement, we are still working on that," a senior Sidek executive, who asked not to be named, told Reuters in a telephone interview.
"The shares are up on market-driven movements," he added.

Sidek will request authorization at an ordinary shareholders assembly on May 30 to sell assets worth 20 percent of its shareholding capital or more to Situr or some other subsidiary, according to an agenda published in April.
